channel.title: PC LOAD LETTER: Two Guys, One Mic
channel.description: Ben Collins-Sussman and and Brian Fitzpatrick answer your questions about open source software development, collaborative software development tools, and the problems that inevitably arise when you try to write software with other people.
channel.itunes:author: Ben Collins-Sussman and Brian Fitzpatrick
channel.itunes:subtitle: Ben and Fitz answer your questions about open source software development
channel.itunes:summary: Ben Collins-Sussman and and Brian Fitzpatrick answer your questions about open source software development, collaborative software development tools, and the problems that inevitably arise when you try to write software with other people.

item.title: PC LOAD LETTER Episode 4: Google's Summer of Code
item.description: Discussion with Leslie Hawthorn, leader of Google's Summer of Code Project
item.itunes:author: Ben Collins-Sussman and Brian Fitzpatrick
item.itunes:subtitle: Discussion with Leslie Hawthorn, leader of Google's Summer of Code Project
item.itunes:summary: Discussion with Leslie Hawthorn, leader of Google's Summer of Code Project
item.itunes:keywords: technology, open source, free software, poisonous people, conflict

item.title: PC LOAD LETTER Episode 3: Formal Organizations in Open Source
item.description: Pros and cons of setting up formal organizations in the open source world
item.itunes:author: Ben Collins-Sussman and Brian Fitzpatrick
item.itunes:subtitle: Pros and cons of setting up formal organizations in the open source world
item.itunes:summary: Pros and cons of setting up formal organizations in the open source world
item.itunes:keywords: technology, open source, free software, poisonous people, conflict

item.title: PC LOAD LETTER Episode 2: The History of Subversion and How It Became Mainstream
item.description: History of Subversion, getting to 1.0, the tipping point where Subversion became mainstream. Also includes some anecdotes about CVS, BDB, and what took Subversion so long to reach 1.0.
item.itunes:author: Ben Collins-Sussman and Brian Fitzpatrick
item.itunes:subtitle: History of Subversion, getting to 1.0, the tipping point where Subversion became mainstream. Also includes some anecdotes about CVS, BDB, and what took Subversion so long to reach 1.0.
item.itunes:summary: History of Subversion, getting to 1.0, the tipping point where Subversion became mainstream. Also includes some anecdotes about CVS, BDB, and what took Subversion so long to reach 1.0.
item.itunes:keywords: technology, open source, free software, poisonous people, conflict

item.title: PC LOAD LETTER Episode 1: The Early Days
item.description: Who we are, annoying airplane people, how we got started in Subversion, the beginnings of the Subversion project, what this podcast is about, and a call for questions.
item.itunes:author: Ben Collins-Sussman and Brian Fitzpatrick
item.itunes:subtitle: Who we are, annoying airplane people, how we got started in Subversion, the beginnings of the Subversion project, what this podcast is about, and a call for questions.
item.itunes:summary: Who we are, annoying airplane people, how we got started in Subversion, the beginnings of the Subversion project, what this podcast is about, and a call for questions.
item.itunes:keywords: technology, open source, free software, poisonous people, conflict
